attachments.title: How can I have fixed-width format of an interpolated string in markdown Julia?
attachments.text: Let's say I have a variable filename = &quot;/home/jimmy/logger.log&quot;. I want to have some markdown documentation like this: md&quot;&quot;&quot; The output is logged at `$(filename)` &quot;&qu...
attachments.fallback: Stack Overflow: How can I have fixed-width format of an interpolated string in markdown Julia?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/54777| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
Hey <@U017JTQFNEQ>, if you were able to find an answer here on Slack, please cross post it to Discourse via the link above. Thank you!
